types.name: Query
types.description:
Queries for the Manifold GraphQL API.

More details and usage available in our
[documentation](https://docs.manifold.co/docs/graphql-apis-AWRk3LPzpjcI5ynoCtuZs).

fields.name: provider
fields.description:
Look up a Provider by its `id` or `label`. Exactly one of `id` or `label` is
required, and `id` has precedence over `label`.

fields.name: plan
fields.description: Look up a Plan by its `id`. `id` is required.

fields.name: product
fields.description: Look up a Product by its `id` or label. Exactly one of `id` or `label` is required, and `id` has precedence over `label`.

fields.name: categories
fields.description: List all available categories in the system.

fields.name: category
fields.description: Look up a category by its label.

fields.name: products
fields.description: List all available products.

fields.name: profile
fields.description:
Look up a profile by `id`, by `subject`, or based on the currently authenticated profile.

Note: Subject owner is currently only supported with use of a Platform API token.

fields.name: node
fields.description: Look up a node by its `id`.

fields.name: resources
fields.description:
Return a paginated list of resources. The return value can either contain
 all available resources linked to the token, or can be filtered down to
 fetch data for the specified profile. The owner can either be a ProfileID or
 a Subject ID which represents the ProfileID, or a SubjectID within a specific Platform.

Note: Subject owner is currently only supported with use of a Platform API token.

fields.name: resource
fields.description:
Fetch a resource for the specified `label` or `id`. When authenticated as a
profile user, fetches the resource associated with the profile. When
authenticated as a platform user and a label is specified, an owner must be provided.
When `deleted` is not specified, it defaults to FALSE.

Note: Subject owner is currently only supported with use of a Platform API token.

fields.name: profiles
fields.description:
Return a paginated list of profiles for a platform, optionally
querying for only profiles with subscription usage over a specified time.

Note: This query is currently only supported with use of a Platform API token.

fields.name: invoice
fields.description: Look up an invoice by its `id`.

fields.name: lineItem
fields.description: Look up a line item by it's `id`.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Provider
types.description: A Provider in Manifold's catalog. Providers own products.

fields.name: label
fields.description: A URL-friendly label for this provider. Globally unique.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: A human-readable display name for this provider.

fields.name: logoUrl
fields.description: The URL of the logo for this provider.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL of this provider's primary website.

fields.name: supportEmail
fields.description: The email address for contacting this provider with support requests.

fields.name: products
fields.description: The list of products associated with this provider.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: ProductOrderBy
types.description: ProductOrderBy defines how a product connection is to be ordered.

types.name: ProductOrderByField
types.description: ProductOrderByField is the field by which the product list will be ordered.

types.name: OrderByDirection
types.description: The direction used to order results.

types.name: ProductConnection
types.description: A ProductConnection is the connection containing Product edges.

types.name: ProductEdge
types.description: A ProductEdge is an edge of a ProductConnection.

types.name: Product
types.description: Product represents a provider's product.

fields.name: provider
fields.description: Provider is the provider associated with this product. It can be null if the provider cannot be retrieved.

fields.name: state
fields.description: State is the current state of a product.

fields.name: screenshots
fields.description: Screenshots provide a list of all images in a product listing's details.

fields.name: images
fields.description: Images provide a list of all images in a product listing's details.

fields.name: valueProps
fields.description: ValueProps is a list of value propositions with a header and a body. It is non-nullable, but it can be empty.

fields.name: valuePropsHtml
fields.description: ValuePropsHtml is the HTML representation of the value propositions. It is non-nullable, but it can be empty.

fields.name: setupStepsHtml
fields.description:
SetupStepsHtml is the HTML representation of the setup steps required to
configure a new product. It is non-nullable, but it can be empty.

fields.name: plans
fields.description: List Plans associated with the product

fields.name: categories
fields.description: Categories are the catalog categories associated with this product.

fields.name: settings
fields.description: Settings describes how the product integrates with the marketplace.

types.name: ProductState
types.description: ProductState is an enum of possible product states.

types.name: ProductScreenshot
types.description: ProductScreenshot includes the information to find and order a screenshot.

types.name: ValueProp
types.description: ValueProp is a value proposition.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: PlanOrderBy
types.description: PlanOrderBy defines how a plan connection is to be ordered.

types.name: PlanOrderByField
types.description: PlanOrderByField is the field by which a plan list will be ordered.

types.name: PlanConnection
types.description: A PlanConnection is the connection between a plan and its containing product.

types.name: PlanEdge
types.description: A PlanEdge is an edge of a PlanConnection.

types.name: Plan
types.description: Plan is the product plan.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: A human-readable display name for this plan.

fields.name: label
fields.description:
A URL-friendly label for this Region, combining its platform and dataCenter
with a hyphen. Globally unique.

fields.name: product
fields.description: The product associated with this plan.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The current state of the plan.

fields.name: fixedFeatures
fields.description: A list of fixed features associated with the plan.

fields.name: meteredFeatures
fields.description: A list of metered features associated with the plan.

fields.name: configurableFeatures
fields.description: A list of configurable features associated with the plan.

fields.name: cost
fields.description: The plan's base cost without the addition of metered features costs

fields.name: free
fields.description: If the plan is free, including if there are metered features changing the cost of a plan with base cost 0.

fields.name: regions
fields.description: The data centers associated with this plan.

types.name: PlanState
types.description: PlanState is an enumeration of possible plan states.

types.name: FixedFeaturesOrderBy
types.description: Order by which to sort fixed features.

types.name: FixedFeaturesOrderByField
types.description: Fields by which to sort fixed features.

types.name: PlanFixedFeatureConnection
types.description: PlanFixedFeaturesConnection is the connection between a plan and its value propositions.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description:
PageInfo provides support for
[Relay](https://facebook.github.io/relay/graphql/connections.htm) cursor-connections style pagination.

types.name: PlanFixedFeatureEdge
types.description: PlanFixedFeatureEdge is an edge of a PlanFixedFeatureConnection.

types.name: PlanFixedFeature
types.description: PlanFixedFeature is a value proposition of a plan.

types.name: MeteredFeaturesOrderBy
types.description: Order by which to sort metered features.

types.name: MeteredFeaturesOrderByField
types.description: Fields by which to sort metered features.

types.name: PlanMeteredFeatureConnection
types.description: PlanMeteredFeatureConnection is the connection between a plan and its metered properties.

types.name: PlanMeteredFeatureEdge
types.description: PlanMeteredFeatureEdge is an edge of a PlanMeteredFeatureConnection.

types.name: PlanMeteredFeature
types.description: PlanMeteredFeature is a metered feature of a plan.

types.name: PlanMeteredFeatureNumericDetails
types.description: PlanMeteredFeatureNumericDetails contains the numeric details of a metered plan feature.

types.name: PlanFeatureCostTier
types.description: PlanFeatureCostTier represents a cost tier in a plan.

types.name: ConfigurableFeaturesOrderBy
types.description: Order by which to sort configurable features.

types.name: ConfigurableFeaturesOrderByField
types.description: Fields by which to sort configurable features.

types.name: PlanConfigurableFeatureConnection
types.description: PlanConfigurableFeatureConnection is the connection between a plan and its configurable properties.

types.name: PlanConfigurableFeatureEdge
types.description: PlanConfigurableFeatureEdge is an edge of a PlanConfigurableFeatureConnection.

types.name: PlanConfigurableFeature
types.description: PlanConfigurableFeature is a configurable feature of a plan.

types.name: PlanFeatureType
types.description: PlanFeatureType is an enumeration of different types of plans.

types.name: PlanConfigurableFeatureNumericDetails
types.description: PlanConfigurableFeatureNumericDetails contains the numeric details of a configurable plan feature.

types.name: RegionsOrderBy
types.description: RegionsOrderBy is an input defining how to order regions.

types.name: RegionsOrderByField
types.description: RegionsOrderByField is an enum of fields by which regions will be ordered.

types.name: Region
types.description: A Region is a data center within a cloud provider's platform.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: A human-readable display name for this region.

fields.name: platform
fields.description: The commercial cloud provider that hosts the region.

fields.name: dataCenter
fields.description: A platform-specific data center identifier.

types.name: Category
types.description: Category represents the category an entity is in.

types.name: ProductSettings
types.description: ProductSettings describes how the product integrates with the marketplace.

fields.name: ssoSupported
fields.description: Whether or not the product supports SSO allowing users to visit its dashboard.

fields.name: credentialsSupport
fields.description: Describes product credentials support.

types.name: ProductCredentialsSupportType
types.description:
ProductCredentialsSupportType describes product credentials support.

* `NONE`: means that no credentials are necessary to access the product.
    This can happen for products that are only usable through their dashboard.
* `SINGLE`: means that the product only supports one credential set at a single time.
* `MULTIPLE`: means that the product supports multiple credential sets at a single time.

types.name: CategoryConnection
types.description: CategoryConnection is a connection between an entity and its categories.

types.name: CategoryEdge
types.description: CategoryEdge is an edge of a CategoryConnection.

types.name: ProfileIdentity
types.description:
ProfileIdentity allows fetching a profile by its `id` or
by its `subject`.

types.name: Profile
types.description: Profile represents a consumer in the Manifold system.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the profile which is internally used.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: Subject represents the identifier of the profile on the platform's side.

fields.name: platform
fields.description: Platform represents the platform this profile belongs to.

fields.name: invoicePreview
fields.description:
InvoicePreview provides a preview of the customers invoice
for the current billing cycle as of midnight UTC.

An invoice preview consists of the amount due and related details at
a specific moment in time. It does not represent an estimation of the
amount that will be due at the end of the billing cycle.

*This is only an invoice preview. It should not be used to charge users.*

Note: This is currently only supported with a Platform API token.

fields.name: invoices
fields.description:
Invoices returns a paginated list of invoices.

Note: This is currently only supported with a Platform API token.

types.name: Platform
types.description: Platform represents a platform where a Manifold marketplace has been published.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the platform, for internal usage.

fields.name: domain
fields.description: The domain associated with the platform.

types.name: Invoice
types.description: Invoice represents the total amount due in a specific billing period.

fields.name: cost
fields.description:
Cost is the amount due for the invoice.

The cost is provided in the currencys smallest unit.

Example: `1000` is `1000 cents` which is `$10 USD`.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Currency is the currency of the `cost` field.

fields.name: start
fields.description: Start indicates when the invoice's period starts.

fields.name: end
fields.description: End indicates when the invoice's period ends.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status represents the current status of the invoice

fields.name: lineItems
fields.description: List LineItems composing the invoice.

types.name: Currency
types.description: Currency is the supported currency, represented as an ISO currency code.

types.name: Time
types.description:
Time represents a point in time formatted as an
[RFC3339](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt) formatted string.

Example: `2009-11-10T23:00:00Z`

types.name: InvoiceStatus
types.description: InvoiceStatus represents the current status of an Invoice

types.name: LineItemConnection
types.description: LineItemConnection is the connection between an invoice and its lineItems.

types.name: LineItemEdge
types.description: LineItemEdge is an edge of LineItemConnection.

types.name: LineItem
types.description: LineItem represents the amount due for a resource.

fields.name: cost
fields.description:
Cost is the amount due for the associated resource.

The cost is provided in the currencys smallest unit.

Example: `1000` is `1000 cents` which is `$10 USD`.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Currency is the currency of the `cost` field.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration is the time horizon for the associated resources billing (monthly, yearly).

fields.name: renewalPoint
fields.description: RenewalPoint describes the renewal behavior (calendar, anniversary).

fields.name: chargeTime
fields.description: ChargeTime describes the charge behavior (post-paid, pre-paid).

fields.name: resource
fields.description: Resource is the resource associated with this line item.

fields.name: subLineItems
fields.description: List SubLineItems composing the line item.

types.name: Duration
types.description: Duration is a representation of the length a cycle.

types.name: RenewalPoint
types.description: RenewalPoint is a representation of when the cycle renewal occurs.

types.name: ChargeTime
types.description: ChargeTime is representation of when the charge for a cycle occurs.

types.name: Resource
types.description:
A resource represents the provisioned version of a selected product. It is
linked to a plan and has credentials associated with it.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: A human-readable display name for this resource.

fields.name: label
fields.description: A machine-readable label for this resource, unique per owner.

fields.name: ssoSupported
fields.description: Whether or not a user can SSO into this resource's product dashboard.

fields.name: ssoUrl
fields.description:
The URL used to redirect the user to this resource's product dashboard. When requested, this field will
return a unique and short-lived URL that can be used to redirect the user towards the product dashboard. If
not used, the URL will expire after around 5 minutes and another one will need to be requested.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Indicates the availability status of the resource

fields.name: plan
fields.description:
The plan for which this resource is provisioned. The plan can be null if the
resource is a custom resource, or if a transient failure occurred.

fields.name: region
fields.description:
The region for which this resource is provisioned. The region can be null if the
resource is a custom resource, or if a transient failure occurred.

fields.name: owner
fields.description:
The profile which owns the resource.

Note: If the resource is not owned by a Platform Profile, the value is null.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time the resource was created at.

fields.name: credentials
fields.description: A list of credentials which can be used to access the Resource.

types.name: ResourceStatus
types.description: ResourceStatus represents the current availability status of a Resource

types.name: ResourceStatusLabel
types.description: ResourceStatusLabel is an enum representing the possible status a resource can have.

types.name: CredentialConnection
types.description:
CredentialsConnection allows a type to set up a connection to list associated
credentials.

types.name: CredentialEdge
types.description:
CredentialsEdge represents a single item on a CredentialsConnection page which
has a cursor that can be used for pagination and holds the actual credential
information.

types.name: Credential
types.description:
Credential represents a plain-text value for a credential which can be used to
configure a resource.

fields.name: key
fields.description: The key for referencing the credential.

fields.name: value
fields.description:
The plain-text value of the credential. This value is the value that can be
used in the actual configuration for the resource.

types.name: SubLineItemConnection
types.description: SubLineItemConnection is the connection between a lineItem and its subLineItems.

types.name: SubLineItemEdge
types.description: SubLineItemEdge is an edge of SubLineItemConnection.

types.name: SubLineItem
types.description:
SubLineItem represents the breakdown by base cost, features, and metered usage
of the amount due by resource.

fields.name: cost
fields.description:
Cost is the amount due for the feature.

The cost is provided in the currencys smallest unit.

Example: `1000` is `1000 cents` which is `$10 USD`.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Currency is the currency of the `cost` field.

fields.name: plan
fields.description: Plan is the plan associated with the SubLineItem.

fields.name: item
fields.description: Item is the feature name (either base-cost, or a customized name).

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description is the value for the feature, or a metering bucket.

fields.name: calculationType
fields.description: CalculationType defines the features billing behavior (prorated, usage).

fields.name: start
fields.description: Start indicates when the feature started to take effect.

fields.name: end
fields.description: End indicates when the feature stopped taking effect.

types.name: CalculationType
types.description: CalculationType represents the known calculation types possible for SubLineItems.

types.name: InvoiceOrderBy
types.description: InvoiceOrderBy defines how an invoice connection is to be ordered.

types.name: InvoiceOrderByField
types.description: InvoiceOrderByField is the field by which an Invoice list will be ordered.

types.name: InvoiceConnection
types.description: InvoiceConnection is the connection between an entity and its invoices.

types.name: InvoiceEdge
types.description: InvoiceEdge is an edge of InvoiceConnection.

types.name: ResourceConnection
types.description:
ResourceConnection allows a type to set up a connection to list associated
resources.

types.name: ResourceEdge
types.description:
ResourceEdge represents a single item on a Resources Connection page which has
a cursor that can be used for pagination and holds the actual resource
information.

types.name: IsDeleted
types.description:
IsDeleted is an enum indicating whether a query should search for deleted records.
When value is MAYBE, query searches both deleted and non-deleted records

types.name: WithUsage
types.description:
WithUsage allows fetching profiles that have been used after the start date,
before the end date, or between the start and end date.

inputFields.name: start
inputFields.description: Start allows fetching profiles used after this date.

inputFields.name: end
inputFields.description: End allows fetching profiles used before this date.

types.name: ProfileConnection
types.description: ProfileConnection is the connection containing Profile edges.

types.name: ProfileEdge
types.description: ProfileEdge is the edge of a ProfileConnection.

types.name: Mutation
types.description:
Mutations for the Manifold GraphQL API

More details and usage available in our
[documentation](https://docs.manifold.co/docs/graphql-apis-AWRk3LPzpjcI5ynoCtuZs).

fields.name: createResource
fields.description:
Create an asynchronous request to create a resource with Manifold. If the owner ID is omitted in the input,
the system will try to find that owner using the given authentication token.

Note: The operations on resources in Manifold are asynchronous. The resource returned by this endpoint will get updated
thoughout the operation lifecycle. This endpoint returns the  preview of the resource before it is created.

fields.name: updateResource
fields.description: Updates a resource synchronously using the provided input.

fields.name: updateResourcePlan
fields.description:
Create an asynchronous request to update a resource's plan with Manifold using the provided resource ID. If the owner
ID is omitted in the input, the system will try to find that owner using the given authentication token. The owner
must have access to the resource for it to be updatable.

Note: The operations on resources in Manifold are asynchronous. The resource returned by this endpoint will get updated
thoughout the operation lifecycle. This endpoint returns the resource before it is updated.

fields.name: deleteResource
fields.description:
Create an asynchronous request to delete a resource with Manifold using the provided resource ID. If the owner
ID is omitted in the input, the system will try to find that owner using the given authentication token. The owner
must have access to the resource for it to be deprovisionable.

Note: The operations on resources in Manifold are asynchronous. The resource returned by this endpoint will get updated
thoughout the operation lifecycle. This endpoint returns the resource before it is deleted.

fields.name: updateInvoiceStatus
fields.description:
Update the status of an Invoice to mark it as paid.

Possible actions are:
- ATTEMPT: A payment was tried, but was unable to be collected (also requires a reason)
- COLLECTED: A payment was tried, and was successfully collected (does not require a reason)

fields.name: createProfileAuthToken
fields.description:
Create a Manifold Auth Token for a Profile.

Note: You must authenticate with a platform api token.

fields.name: updateProfileSubject
fields.description:
Update a profile subject.

Changing the subject will change the subject linked to a platform profile.
This results in changing the owner for the platform profile.
The subject is the platform's external id that is linked to a platform profile.

The consequences are:
* the new owner will be charged for this complete billing cycle
* the new owner will have access to all the historical data (invoices) of the Profile


Note: Transferring resource ownership between two profiles is also possible
and allows to split the charge of the billing cycle by usage and to keep
historical data ownership separated.
Only Platform API tokens are able to change subjects.

types.name: CreateResourceInput
types.description: A request input type for creating a new resource.

inputFields.name: label
inputFields.description: A URL friendly label for this Resource. Globally unique.

inputFields.name: displayName
inputFields.description: A human readble display name for this Resource.

inputFields.name: ownerId
inputFields.description: The id of the owner for this resource. Omit to use the current user ID.

inputFields.name: productId
inputFields.description: The product to provision for this resource.

inputFields.name: planId
inputFields.description: The plan to provision for this resource on the given product.

inputFields.name: regionId
inputFields.description: The region to provision this resource to, must be supported by the plan.

types.name: CreateResourcePayload
types.description: The payload for a provisioned resource.

fields.name: data
fields.description: The provisioned resource body

types.name: UpdateResourceInput
types.description: A request input type for updating an existing resource

inputFields.name: resourceId
inputFields.description: The ID of the resource to update

inputFields.name: newLabel
inputFields.description: The new label to give to this resource

inputFields.name: newDisplayName
inputFields.description: The new display name to give to this resource

types.name: UpdateResourcePayload
types.description: The payload for an updated resource.

fields.name: data
fields.description: The updated resource body

types.name: UpdateResourcePlanInput
types.description: A request input type for updating an existing resource's plan.

inputFields.name: resourceId
inputFields.description: The ID of the resource to resize

inputFields.name: newPlanID
inputFields.description: The id of the new plan to assign for this resource.

inputFields.name: ownerId
inputFields.description: The id of the owner for this resource. Omit to use the current user ID.

types.name: UpdateResourcePlanPayload
types.description: The payload for a resource whose plan changed.

fields.name: data
fields.description: The updated resource body

types.name: DeleteResourceInput
types.description: A request input type for deprovisoning an existing resource.

inputFields.name: resourceId
inputFields.description: The ID of the resource to deprovision

inputFields.name: ownerId
inputFields.description: The id of the owner for this resource. Omit to use the current user ID.

types.name: DeleteResourcePayload
types.description: The payload for a deprovisioned resource.

fields.name: data
fields.description: The deprovisioned resource body

types.name: InvoiceStatusInput
types.description: PayInvoiceMutation is the mutation input for updating an Invoice to paid

types.name: InvoiceAction
types.description: InvoiceAction is the mutation action to be taken on an Invoice

types.name: CreateProfileAuthTokenInput
types.description:
CreateProfileAuthTokenInput requires a profileId in order to create a scoped auth token.
The profileId must be the same profileId the platform uses to expose identity and authorization
To manifold.

types.name: CreateProfileAuthTokenPayload
types.description:
The payload for creating an auth token returns a profile-scoped auth token
available for use with manifold.

types.name: ProfileAuthToken
types.description: The profile-scoped auth token that is available for use to authenticate with manifold.

types.name: UpdateProfileSubjectInput
types.description:
UpdateProfileSubjectInput accepts a profile subject for a given profileId.
The subject is the new subject to update to.
The id is the profile identity, it can either be a subject (the platform's id) or a manifold internal profileId.

types.name: UpdateProfileSubjectPayload
types.description: The payload from updating the profile subject is the update profile.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax (as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).
